page.title: 18 AGRICULTURE (2),MAIDSTONE
page.content: within this area are few - mainly {wheat}at 759585 and 745585. {Rough grazing}predominates elsewhere, as at 756583, 725572, 748584 and 752582. A{detailed survey}of the area showed that the majority of land under agriculture was found on the{Hythe {Beds}where a wide scale of soil pH from 6 to 8 allowed for greater crop variety such as strawberries, hops,orchards,potatoes, oil seed rape and gooseberries. From our analysis it can be concluded that there is a {direct correlation between soil {fertility and land use in this area. The{rough grazing}was found mainly on river gravels, head deposits, silky clay/Fuller's earth and Folkestone Beds.{Orchards}were found predominantly on the Hythe Beds.
